SafetyInspectionBy: Iowa Dept. of Agriculture & Land Stewardship

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility: Key Coopertive - New Sharon    

Contact: Mark Gaunt

Phone:   515-388-4341    

1. Facility Policy: 

    The owners, management and employees of Key Cooperative are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the New Sharon fire department, Mahaska County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.

2. Facility Information:

    The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers. The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production. Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.

3. The Worst-Case Release Scenario and the Alternate Release Scenario:

    An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental releases have been addressed in our Hazard Assessment and information is in our Risk Management Program.

4. Accidental Release Prevention Program 

        The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and     Handling

     of Anhydrous Ammonia" and our state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia. The OSHA Standard     is referenced in this RMP Registration Form; see Section 8.3.(b).

5.    Five-Year Accident History 

        There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge have there been any accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuation, property damage, or environmental damage.

6.    Emergency Action Plan

    The facility has:

    a. A written Emergency Action Plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.38;

    b. Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and Community right-to-know info

rmation as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);

    c. If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.

7.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

    Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of Key Cooperative - New Sharon. There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
